intro: Oxera pulchella var. grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora oxera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
